input.description: Delete old middleware file from wrong location

content.text:
Done. The middleware has been moved from `app/middleware.ts` to `app/src/middleware.ts`, which is the correct location since the project uses a `src/` directory structure.

Next.js will now pick up the middleware file, and unauthenticated users will be redirected to `/login`. To verify:

1. Restart the dev server (`npm run dev`)
2. Open `http://localhost:3000/` in an incognito window — it should redirect to `/login`
3. Run `npm run build` to confirm the build still succeeds

message.content: give me a commit message for these changes

content.thinking: The user wants a commit message for the changes. Let me look at what was changed.

content.text:
```
Fix auth redirect by moving middleware to src/middleware.ts

Next.js only picks up middleware at the same level as the app/
directory. Since the project uses src/app/, the middleware must
live at src/middleware.ts, not at the project root.
```

message.content: I mean for ALL the changes we have done so far

content.text:
This is the initial commit for the entire project — there are no prior commits. Here's a commit message:

```
Initial commit: Partio app with GitHub OAuth and checkpoint dashboard

Next.js app with NextAuth (GitHub OAuth), dashboard for browsing
repositories and Claude Code checkpoints, diff viewing, and session
transcripts. Middleware at src/middleware.ts guards all routes behind
authentication.
```
